title: Validate Wide Matrix Data Format — validate_wide_matrix
Validate Wide Matrix Data Format — validate_wide_matrix
text: df data frame validate. Expected contain 'PlotID' column matrix columns names following pattern 'S##_D##' (e.g., S01_D01, S02_D15), ## represents two-digit numbers.

title: Validate Wide Matrix Data Format — validate_wide_matrix
text: character vector error messages. data frame valid,   returns empty character vector (length 0). validation fails, returns   vector containing descriptive error messages issue found.

title: Validate Wide Matrix Data Format — validate_wide_matrix
code: # Valid data frame valid_df <- data.frame(   PlotID = c("Plot1", "Plot2"),   S01_D01 = c(1.2, 1.5),   S01_D02 = c(2.1, 2.3),   S02_D01 = c(0.8, 1.1) ) validate_wide_matrix(valid_df)  # Returns character(0) #> NULL  # Invalid data frame - missing PlotID invalid_df1 <- data.frame(   Site = c("A", "B"),   S01_D01 = c(1.2, 1.5) ) validate_wide_matrix(invalid_df1)  # Returns error message #> [1] "Missing required column: PlotID"  # Invalid data frame - no matrix columns invalid_df2 <- data.frame(   PlotID = c("Plot1", "Plot2"),   SomeCol = c("a", "b") ) validate_wide_matrix(invalid_df2)  # Returns error message #> [1] "No matrix columns found. Expect names like S01_D01, S01_D02, ..."  # Invalid data frame - non-numeric matrix columns invalid_df3 <- data.frame(   PlotID = c("Plot1", "Plot2"),   S01_D01 = c("1.2", "1.5"),  # character instead of numeric   S01_D02 = c(2.1, 2.3) ) validate_wide_matrix(invalid_df3)  # Returns error message #> [1] "Non-numeric matrix columns: S01_D01"
